intro: Glochidion macrocarpum f. depressoglobosum, commonly known as the depressed globe glochidion, is a rare variant of the glochidion genus native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, rounded, and often swollen fruit bodies, which are typically yellow to orange in color. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
